children.name: European Macro-Financial Assistance
children.description: Loans, of which €2.81 billion was provided. This is the largest amount of macro-financial assistance that the EU has disbursed to any non-EU country.

children.name: European Investment Bank
children.description: Loans by the EIB between 2014-2016. Support infrastructure development and reforming the transport,  energy,  agriculture, education and municipal sectors. Substantial financial and technical support for SME development.

children.name: European Bank for Reconstruction and Development
children.name1: European Bank for Reconstruction and Development
children.description: Investment from 2014-2017, from the EU, to develop and reform, the banking sector, agribusiness, transport, small businesses in UKR.  Facilitated the purchase of $300 million of gas for the 2015-2016 heating season.

children.name: European Neighbourhood Instrument grants
children.description: Instrument Grants, include a €355 million state building contract to fight against corruption and reform the public administration, the judiciary, the constitution and the electoral framework.

children.name1: Instrument contributing to Stability and Peace
children.description: From 2014 on, to observe and build confidence and support the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission, Internally Displaced Persons, conflict-affected populations, restoration of governance and reconciliation in crisis-affected communities as well as  police reform.
